entry.title: Introduce target_utils in ChromeDriver
entry.content:
This commit includes the following changes:

* Some common code related to target handling is moved from ChromeImpl,

ChromeDesktopImpl and chrome_launcher to the newly created

target_utils module. This simplifies the code maintenance.

This module will also be used in the upcoming C++ integration tests.

* WebViewInfo and WebViewsInfo are extracted from devtools_http_client.

They can be used independently in target_utils.



Bug: chromedriver:4528

Change-Id: Id29d8973758c018eddaf536cf7a859c507cef34c

entry.title: Cookie Controls: Animate entrypoint when effective setting changes
entry.content:
CL introduces a method on the CookieSettingsController which fires

when the same page is loaded after a change to the effective cookie setting.



This new method is used to power the existing closing of the

reloading view in the CookieControlsBubbleViewController (and is

covered by the current tests), as well as additionally animate the icon entry point.



Video of result @ crbug.com/1446230#c98

entry.title: CCA: Make bundled CCA work under subpath
entry.content:
Currently the output of `cca.py bundle` doesn't work when not served

under root of a domain, since there's many reference of URL that start

with '/'.



To solve this, rewrite all URL pattern in HTML/CSS files to relative

path, and change the path to include subpath in runtime for JS files.



Bug: b:231413193

Test: `cca.py dev` and open with local chrome.

Test: `cca.py bundle` and serve with static http server under subpath

Change-Id: I6823f6f3209fb7aa4fea523dba97f45f3210878e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4699163

Reviewed-by: Shik Chen

Reviewed-by: Chu-Hsuan Yang

entry.title: [iOS] Stop editing node when dismissing BookmarkHomeViewController
entry.content:
When calling `-[BookmarkHomeViewController shutdown]`,

This patch will be probably cherry-picked on M116.

entry.title: History: Support "external" referrers
entry.content:
In the history DB, a visit's referrer is stored in the form of a

"pointer" to another visit (i.e. the referring visit's ID is stored).



That works well in most cases, but sometimes, no actual referring

visit exists. This is the case for links opened from outside of

Chrome, notably from AGA.



Before this CL, HistoryBackend would just drop the referrer URL in

such cases.

This CL introduces an "external_referrer_url" column in the visits

table, which gets populated with the referrer URL only if no actual

referrer visit exists. It also adds plumbing so that these "external"

referrers get synced.



Bug: 1466964

Change-Id: I13054961d3e0eeffa8bfd8fa249acf6f75c24704

entry.title: Sync initialization: Improve histograms about account state
entry.content:
Previously, histograms "Sync.Startup.AccountInfoFullyLoaded2" and

"Sync.Startup.SignedInWithoutAccountInfo2" (recently introduced in

crrev.com/c/4607203) were recorded for all profiles, including

non-regular ones (e.g. the signin profile on ChromeOS).

This CL replaces them by "2"-suffixed versions that are only recorded

for regular profiles, similar to "Sync.InitialState2".

This makes analysis much easier, since the non-regular profiles

contributed a lot of useless noise.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Sync.Startup.AccountInfoFullyLoaded]=Replaced by Sync.Startup.AccountInfoFullyLoaded2.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Sync.Startup.SignedInWithoutAccountInfo]=Replaced by Sync.Startup.SignedInWithoutAccountInfo2.



Bug: 1454037

Change-Id: Ie485775c494ba2f786f05b7874a89228fab7f1d6

entry.title: Reland "Add FileTransferEnterpriseConnectorUI feature"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 95a3ee98db8d43cdb0db37321bda6ded8c50a9d5.



Reason for revert: Adding again, modifying incorrect enums.xml



Original change's description:

> Revert "Add FileTransferEnterpriseConnectorUI feature"

>

> This reverts commit 9a8fee9e0ac14758cc7810c12919f92ae20d4826.

>

> Reason for revert: CL caused linux presubmit to fail. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-presubmit/6947/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > Add FileTransferEnterpriseConnectorUI feature

entry.title: [GPU] Have GLTextureImageBacking use its own passthrough rep impl
entry.content:
GLTextureImageBacking and ANGLEVulkanImageBacking currently share an

implementation for GLTexturePassthroughImageRepresentation. However, the

GLTextureImageBacking impl is in reality trivial as it doesn't pass a

Client implementation to the representation. This CL changes

GLTextureImageBacking to use its own implementation. A followup will

then move the previously-shared implementation into

ANGLEVulkanImageBacking itself, enabling removal of the Client

abstraction altogether and resulting in more straightforward code for

both backings.



Change-Id: I282bbd11ef218b8510b12c55eb91110ffaa2f88b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4721387

entry.title: Suppress WebTransport handshake failure delay for web_tests
entry.content:
Some WPTs explicitly fail handshakes. Since

WebTransportThrottleContext is shared among all shared and service

workers, adding 5 mins penalty results in test time outs. To work

around the issue, suppress handshake failure delays when

`--webtransport-developer-mode` is specified. The flag is already

specified when running WPTs.

entry.title: Fix AutofillTable::MigrateToVersion113...().
entry.content:
Database migration logic should generally not depend on functions that

might change in the future. For example:

- MigrateToVersion113...() is run when the database schema is still in

version 112 and should be migrated to version 113.

- Assume the implementation uses a function f() that inserts some data

into some table T.

- A few versions later, a new column is added to T and f() is changed

to insert a value into this new column as well.

In this case, MigrateToVersion113...() will suddenly start failing,

because the new SQL query in f() references a column that doesn't

exists in the version 112/113 schema.



Exactly this happened in the MigrateToVersion113...() logic - f() is

AddAutofillProfileToTable() in this case.



Currently, for the ProfileTokenQuality project, a new column needs to

be added to the contact_info_type_tokens and local_addresses_type_tokens

tables, which are exactly the tables AddAutofillProfileToTable() reads

from.

Fortunately, the WebDatabase migration unit tests caught this bug

before any new column could be added.



This CL fixes the problem by creating a new function

AddAutofillProfileToTableVersion113(), which represents the state

of AddAutofillProfileToTable(), back when the migration logic was

written.



Bug: 1443393

Change-Id: I320c6eca3e209dce71ef75fbbe0e87b77ac44051

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4721049

Reviewed-by: Jihad Hanna

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Code-Coverage: Findit

entry.title: Revert "[lacros-a11y]: add initial support for Ash-driven C++ Lacros SpokenFeedbackTests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 11e9e3ec89f52f16f19e80a75580ed018b11fb21.



Reason for revert:

Speculative revert. This seems to be failing SpokenFeedbackTests on

linux-chromeos-rel.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-rel/68038/overview



Original change's description:

> [lacros-a11y]: add initial support for Ash-driven C++ Lacros SpokenFeedbackTests

>

> This change adds the needed setup for SpokenFeedbackTests to launch a

> Lacros browser whenever a url is opened.

>

> In addition, it adds a new helper `NavigateToUrl` which opens the given

> url in either Lacros or Ash depending on whether the

> `--lacros-chrome-path` got passed to Chrome (via AshBrowserTestStarter).

>

> Note that these tests could be driven by a Lacros binary (browser test)

> if they get invoked (after a mojo IPC) and report back results with

> minimal changes required and backward compat when run through an Ash

> browser test.

>

> Finally, a subset of tests are left for follow ups (see

> linux-chromeos.browser_tests.require_lacros.filter).

>

> Test: cq/try bots

entry.title: [PhoneHub] Add distinct inline reply send button accessible name
entry.content:
Cvox read aloud identical "reply" announcements for the reply input

textfield and reply send button. This CL adds an accessible name for

the send button and updates the button tooltip to use the same new

string, "Send reply". Having the tooltip match the accessible name

entry.title: Reland "Make network service sandbox be AppContainer not LPAC, for now."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 9e343358c7f7f01f96c473f9962bbc23cb5463c8



This CL updates the test to correctly support the new feature flag.



Original change's description:

> Make network service sandbox be AppContainer not LPAC, for now.

>

> This CL adds a new feature (disabled by default) that determines

> whether or not LPAC is enabled for the network service sandbox.

>

> It has been determined that Network Location Awareness service

> requires ALL APPLICATION PACKAGES (AppContainer) rather than

> ALL RESTRICTED APPLICATION PACKAGES (LPAC) to connect to it,

> causing GetNetworkList to fail.

>

> This CL adds a temporaily weaker sandbox in order to make progress

> on other network service sandbox blockers.

>

> This feature will be enabled again once GetNetworkList has been

> proxied out via mojo.

>

> BUG=1450754

>

> Change-Id: I42d923f676776471a46e6d246e41f90b773416ee

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4708168

> Reviewed-by: James Forshaw

> Commit-Queue: Will Harris

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173691}



BUG=1450754

entry.title: Prerender UKM: NavigationRequest ukm::SourceId for prerendering
entry.content:
Currently, Navigation::GetPreviousPageUkmSourceId() returns an ID

that will not be associated with any URL while prerendering.

This behavior follows the data collection policy.



This patch clarifies the behavior in the method comment, and makes

it return kInvalidSourceId instead of other invalid runtime IDs.

This is a preparation to disallow to call GetPageUkmSourceId

for prerendering frames.

entry.title: borealis: Fix the await task to complete synchronously
entry.content:
This bug is caused by subscription_ still having default value when the

SessionTracker synchronously invokes the callback. We fix it by removing

the check on the subscription.



Checking the subscription was just a trick to avoid double-calling

complete, but that isn't really a problem since complete moves the

callback.



We *did* have a test for this case but, unlike its name suggests, the

container isn't actually there before we add the callback. Fix this and

add an assert.



Bug: None

entry.title: App Management: Remove PreferredAppsList reference to avoid UAF in tests
entry.content:
App Management uses the PreferredAppsList from App Service to listen to

and modify preferred apps settings. In Lacros tests which use a real Ash

process, App Service is reset between tests, and so the stored reference

to PreferredAppsList can become invalid when App Service restarts.



As a simple fix, we change App Management to read the PreferredAppsList

from App Service every time it is needed.



Note that I haven't been able to reliably figure out which Lacros test

is starting App Management, it seems like it might be flaky, which is in

itself a bit worrying.



Bug: 1466885

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Apply relevance penalty to fuzzy suggestions after ml.
entry.content:
The fuzzy provider works by running the bookmark and history quick

providers with a "corrected" input and applying a penalty proportional

to the correction amount to the results. The scoring signals are

populated according to the correct input and leads to an artificially

inflated model output.



This CL attempts to correct for this by applying the same penalty to

fuzzy suggestions post-rescoring using the model results. This is a

relatively quick and dirty solution that allows us to continue testing

for now without having to re-introduce new signals and retrain the model.



Bug: 1466606,1405555

Change-Id: I664a7a60026c4bec0a34ba4c0b8e166f271121cd

entry.title: media/gpu/vea_tests: Don't encode identical frames in a row with --reverse
entry.content:
video_encode_accelerator_(perf_)tests, with --reverse option, encodes

the consecutive frames. But in the reverse point, the identical frames

are encoded. The purpose of --reverse option is to make the encoded

video consecutive as encoded frames are consecutive in practical.

However, the back-to-back identical frames are not practical either.

This CL fixes the reverse algorithm.

entry.title: Don't throw exceptions on unknown codecs or unsupported sizes.
entry.content:
Per spec isConfigSupported() should only throw a TypeError for

invalid configs. An unrecognized codec string doesn't mean the

config is invalid. Even a malformed codec string may just be

a newer standard of a given string.



Instead the spec says we should mark the codec as unsupported

when resolving the isConfigSupported() promise and throw a

NotSupportedError DOMException if that config is given to

configure().



This includes a couple of related changes:

- Chromium now handles missing displayWidth and displayHeight.

- Exceeding Chromium specific bounds reports unsupported.



Unfortunately the web tests weren't quite testing the behavior

required by the spec, so this updates them to do so.



Fixes https://github.com/web-platform-tests/interop/issues/382



Fixed: 1457252

Change-Id: Id6b82dd09fdcb0d389429de15a6b23f6b6e5f56a

Reviewed-by: Dan Sanders

... and CrOS settings browser tests:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4720146/5#message-1c0c053b66febc378078e6fc3c8985acae71097f

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20MSan%20Tests/41982/test-results?sortby=&groupby=



Original change's description:

> WebUI: Include all WebUIMochaBrowserTest tests on Windows cross builds.

>

> Previously all WebUI tests were not included in Windows cross builds,

> because js2gtest was not compatible with such builds

> (crbug.com/1010561). Newer WebUI tests no longer use js2gtest and

> therefore can be successfully built on cross builds.

>

> Splitting include_js_tests flag to two separate flags

> - include_js_tests

> - include_js2gtest_tests

>

> to allow differentiating between old and new tests, and hooking it up

> to the chrome/test/data/webui:{browser_tests,interactive_ui_tests}

> targets.

>

entry.title: [omnibox][webui] Wait only if needed on first access; measure init times
entry.content:
This CL eliminates the handler wait in the webui omnibox popup ctor and

instead blocks on first handler access, only if necessary. In practice

with this design, the wait is expected to be needed rarely if ever

because the handler generally has time to initialize and bind the remote

before the user's first interaction with the omnibox. Since very quick

omnibox access might request the handler before it's ready, we check for

this case and wait as needed. Any waits have their durations recorded,

and this metric is complemented with omnibox first access time

measurement so that we can clearly see the tradeoff.



Bug: 1396174

Change-Id: I4d8519284250400a8435aa5a953023d5fc03fbca

entry.title: [iOS] ensure scene URL loading service is destructed.
entry.content:
The SceneUrlLoadingService was created with the scene controller and

never destructed. It seems the issue was introduced in

https://crrev.com/c/2081427 and as far as I can tell, there was no

reason for the object to outlive the scene controller and, of course,

to be leaked.

entry.title: Move WouldTaintOrigin() out of CanvasRenderingContext.
entry.content:
This utility method was not accessing any of the state of the rendering

context, so there was no reason for it to be a class method. The

previous design also forced an awkward multiple inheritance call path

for calling the method from BaseRenderingContext2D.



This change simplifies the code and prepares for an upcoming CL where we

need to call WouldTaintOrigin from a class that is unrelated.



Bug: 1467562

Change-Id: I194e4ce3523345c002ae13e9f241a4ad49055871

entry.title: Linux network service sandbox: Restrict socketcall() on x86
entry.content:
This makes 32-bit x86 (and MIPS) fail on the same sockets-API

syscalls as the other platforms, rather than allowing socketcall() to be

a bypass for the argument filtering.



This should be a useful for any 32-bit ChromeOS devices still being

updated, any 32-bit Linux Chromium build, and a future Android seccomp

policy for the network service (for the Android emulator).

entry.title: [iOS] Rename overflow menu Action* files that apply to entire menu
entry.content:
The initial design had action and destination customization on separate

screens, so the files were named Action*. However, the designs changed

to put them on the same screen, so the files ended up including both action and destination customization. Rename them to fix this

discrepancy.
